summary: This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate, the appointment of executors, and the powers granted to them. It specifies the handling of debts, expenses, and the management of assets after his death. This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate and the roles of the Executor and Trustee. It includes provisions regarding taxes and the handling of assets after his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the individual whose Last Will and Testament is being executed, detailing the distribution of his estate.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Richard D. Kahn is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will.

persons.name: Kathryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Kathryn H. Ruemmler is appointed as the successor executor in case the primary executors are unable to serve.

persons.context: Habibe Avdiu is the Notary Public who witnessed the signing of the Will and confirmed the identities of the Testator and witnesses.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein appoints Darren K. Indyke as an executor of his estate, indicating a position of trust and responsibility.
Jeffrey E. Epstein appoints Richard D. Kahn as an executor of his estate, indicating a position of trust and responsibility.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are both appointed as executors of Epstein's will, working together in this capacity.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler is designated as a successor executor if the primary executors are unable to serve.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler is designated as a successor executor if the primary executors are unable to serve.

events.title: Execution of Last Will & Testament
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed his Last Will and Testament in the presence of witnesses and a Notary Public.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein revokes all prior wills and codicils with this document.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are appointed as executors, with Kathryn H. Ruemmler as a successor executor.
The will outlines the payment of debts, funeral expenses, and compensation for executors.
Epstein's estate is to be managed according to the provisions of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust.
The document grants extensive powers to the executors regarding the management and distribution of the estate.
The document outlines the roles of the Executor and Trustee in managing Epstein's estate.
It specifies that any beneficiary who does not survive Epstein will have their bequest lapse.
The Will includes provisions for the payment of federal and state taxes related to the estate.
The Will was executed on May 8, 2018, in the presence of witnesses and a Notary Public.
The Notary Public, Habibe Avdiu, confirmed the identities of the Testator and witnesses.
